intro: Parnassia mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican mountain buttercup, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its delicate, white, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain meadows and forest understories. Its leaves are palmately divided, and it produces small, green, berry-like fruits that contain seeds. Parnassia mexicana is often found in alpine and subalpine zones, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions.
